WRITING.TITLE: Reddit, one of my friends has been diagnosed with anorexia. I need your advice on how I can help.
WRITING.TEXT:
A little background story: This is an old coworker of mine, and for as long as I've known her, she's always been petite (I'm a size 4 and she's smaller than I am), but toned and a little curvy.
When I saw her for the first time in 6+ months, she is just skin and bones; blamed it on working out too much. Apparently, her heart rate is down to 40 beats per minute when she's awake. Her mom has arranged for her to see a therapist and a nutritionist, but apparently, she's not cooperating so much mentally.
All of her friends won't talk to her or hang out with her because of this, and she told a mutual friend of ours about it, asking her to help her get better. She doesn't know I know, so I can't really get further information, but our friend is stressing out big time about helping her. Obviously, to us the solution seems simple, but I know our thought processes are so different from hers right now. What can we do?
